description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION CONTAINING SWIMMING POOL. INSTALLATOIN OF NEW BAY WINDOWS ON THE FIRST FLOOR OF THE REAR ELEVATION OF MAIN DWELLINGHOUSE. INSTALLATION OF FIRST FLOOR ROOF TERRACE WITH PRIVACY SCREEN INSTALLED ON EAST SIDE ELEVATION. ERECTION OF SECOND FLOOR REAR ROOF EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: P_01; P_02 (Rev A); P_03; P_04 (Rev A).

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The screening or enclosure to the balcony as shown on the approved plans shall be implemented before the development is first occupied and retained permanently thereafter and shall be obscure glazed.

Condition : 5 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted (apart from designated first floor roof terrace) shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'BS5837:2012 Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Tree Constraints Plan, Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan' dated 'March 2020' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works.

Condition : 8 - The details of the approved 'BS 5837:2012 Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Tree Constraints Plan, Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to monitor and report to the Local Planning Authority not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the demolition and site works. A final Certificate of Completion shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority at the conclusion of all site works.
Condition : 9 - The proposed sedum roof shall be installed prior to occupation of the development.

Condition : 10 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes), from the plant/machinery associated with the proposed plant room shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with the closest noise sensitive receptor.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted, full details of a landscaping and planting scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved before the commencement of the use or the occupation of any building hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include on a plan, full details of the size, species, spacing, quantities and location of proposed plants, together with any hard surfacing, means of enclosure, and indications of all existing trees, hedges and any other features to be retained, and measures for their protection during the course of development.

Condition : 12 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) An extended expiry was agreed with the applicant. 
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
